hypothesis_content.title: BTC-ETH Cointegration Breakout Pairs Trade
hypothesis_content.statement: When the 20-day rolling z-score of the BTC/ETH price ratio exceeds ±2.0 standard deviations from its 200-day mean, a reversion to the mean will occur within 5 trading days with a Sharpe ratio >1.2, but only during NEUTRAL regimes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: BTC and ETH maintain a long-term equilibrium relationship as the two largest crypto assets. During neutral regimes, macro drivers affect both similarly, making relative value discrepancies temporary. The 200-day mean captures the structural relationship while 20-day z-score identifies short-term dislocations.
entry_conditions: BTC/ETH price ratio 20-day z-score > +2.0 (short BTC, long ETH)
BTC/ETH price ratio 20-day z-score < -2.0 (long BTC, short ETH)
Cointegration test (Johansen) p-value < 0.05 over last 200 days

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Z-score moves further to ±3.0 (breakdown of relationship)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days (force exit regardless of PnL)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of trades hit the ±3.0 stop loss before reaching mean reversion, or Sharpe ratio < 0.8 in backtest.
